category: National Sports Competition Regulations/Article 20 (Rights and obligations of host member city/provincial sports associations, etc.)
contents: Article 20 (Rights and obligations of host city/provincial sports associations, etc.) ① City/province and member city/provincial sports associations that have decided to hold the National Sports Festival, etc. must sign an agreement with the sports association (hosting time, host city/provincial sports association obligations, faithful performance, etc.) The organization and succession of the organizing committee, allocation of stadiums, obligations to hold the National Youth Sports Festival and the National Life Sports Festival, etc.) are concluded. And the member city/provincial sports association that has decided to host the event must submit the application plan (purpose and justification for hosting, budget, stadium, lodging, publicity, transportation, volunteer operation, etc.) announced by the board of directors with the head of the metropolitan government and the chairman of the local council of the relevant metropolitan government. The final hosting application plan approved by must be submitted within one week after the venue is decided, and the competition approval conditions and regulations approved by the Sports Association must be faithfully observed. Revised on January 24, 2022. ② Member city/provincial sports associations that have decided to hold a national sports competition, etc. shall submit an implementation plan and performance results based on the agreement and invitation application plan submitted pursuant to paragraph 1 from the year in which the competition was confirmed. It must be submitted by the last week of October every year, limited to the year before the year in which the competition is held. The committee must conduct a follow-up inspection according to the host application plan every year with the host site, and if the plan according to the agreement and the host application plan is not implemented, the host site may be canceled by submitting it to the board of directors. Revised January 24, 2022. ③ If a member city/provincial sports association that has decided to hold a national sports competition, etc. wishes to change the holding time despite the agreement in paragraph 1, the sports council will make the final decision after prior consultation with the head of the local government of the venue. Changes can be made by approval. Revised on January 24, 2022. ④ If a member city/provincial sports association that has decided to hold a national sports competition, etc., gives up on holding the event despite the agreement and invitation plan in Paragraph 1, the member city/provincial sports association is responsible for non-compliance with the agreement and invitation plan. All resulting losses must be compensated, and applications for hosting national sports competitions, etc. cannot be submitted to the Sports Council for the next 20 years from the year in which the event was abandoned. Revised 2022. 1. 24. [Title revised 2022. 1. 24.]
